result.execSummary:
The defendant Noel Almagro Vandiver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noel Almagro Vandiver

defendant.name: Vandiver, Noel Almagro
defendant.address: 3179 Indian Settlement Road, Apt. B, Crandon, WI 54520

records.addlTxt: from DOC - DE has completed programs - enclosed AJC for courts signature

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from DOC requesting clairification of credit
From DOC, requesting days of credit be adjusted. Approved by Judge.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Two letters of support for defendant

Defendant Noel Almagro Vandiver in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Noel Almagro Vandiver in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:34 AM. State - here for SEHR. Counsel has received revocation paperwork, Lynch does not note any errors or inaccuracies. State makes comment in regards to credit, State comes up with 590 days and Lynch comes up with 597 days on count #2 and State has 225 days and Lynch has 232 days on the other counts. Court reviews to figure out credit. All parties stipulate to 596 days credit. State makes final argument prior to recommendations - recommends 8 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years of ES on all counts (counts #2, #4, #6 and #8) - concurrent to each other - if Court orders any eligibility for any programs, State asks that they not take effect until after the first 2 years of prison are served - leaves any unpaid financial obligations up to the Court. Lynch makes final argument prior to his recommendation - recommends 7 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES and asks that the Court make him eligible for any and all programs available. Vandiver makes statement. Court has reviewed the letters filed by Lynch - sentences the defendant to the following: on all counts (#2, #4, #6 and #8) - 8 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - concurrent to each other - credit for 596 days on count #2 and credit for 231 days on counts #4, #6 and #8  - make him eligible for any programs, any unpaid fines to be taken from any accounts/monies available from the defendant in prison at the maximum amount allowable and any unpaid during the prison stay will be a conditiopn of ES, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 12, 2018 at 11:15 am.
Per P&P Agent the defendant is in process of revocation, contesting so will be hearing in front of ALJ.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Noel Almagro Vandiver in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:42 PM. State - defendant will be pleading to counts 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 11 & 13, all other counts will be dismissed and read in. Both parties free to argue on sentence. Rielly asks for court to take plea today and sentence at a later date. Noel Vandiver makes comment in regards to reporting today. Vandiver pleads guilty to Counts 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 11 & 13. Court dismisses and reads in counts 3, 5, 7, 9, 10 & 12.  Court goes over plea questionaire and waiver of rights form and finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and inteligently entering his plea. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guilty. State - makes final argument and recommends: Count 1 - 365 days in FC jail, court costs. Counts 2, 4, 6 & 8 - Probation for 5 years, consecutive to count 1 with conditions of 365 days conditional jail time, AODA and follow through, no consumption or posession of alcohol, not to possess any prescriptions that are not prescribed to him, FT employment, no entry into any bars or taverns unless for work purposes, 300 HR community service, no contact with Shayna McGeshick, Robert McGeshick or Laurie Olds. Count 11 & 13 - $500 plus costs on each count. Rielly makes final argument and recommends: Count 1 - asks for less jail time and asks for good time and huber previleges. 2 days jail credit if revoked, stipulated. Vandiver makes statement, remorseful. State makes statement. Court accepts the recommendation of no prision time and accepts the recommendation of the state and sentences the following: Count 1 - 365 days in FC jail, community service granted, good time and huber allowed and imposes court costs. Counts 2, 4, 6 & 8 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 5 years, consecutive to count 1 with conditions of: 365 days conditional jail time, 300 hours of community, no contact with Shayna McGeshick, Robert McGeshick or Laurie Olds, DOC may imposes any other conditions as they see fit. Counts 11 & 13 - $500 fine plus costs on each count collected through probation. Right to appeal, firearm and voting rights, must submit DNA sample with costs and surcharges. Vandiver makes statement. Court report to jail on Friday, August 14th, no later than 6:00 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Noel Almagro Vandiver
Current: 3179 Indian Settlement Road, Apt. B, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 07-07-2015)
Prior: 3039 State Highway 55, Crandon, WI 54520
8/13/15 JT - resent to 3179 Indian Settlement Road, Apt. B, Crandon, WI

Attorney Michael John Rielly in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:15 pm. No appearance by defendant. Body $5000. No contact from defendant with counsel. Recalled 2:38 pm. Noel Vandiver now appears along with counsel. Court quashes warrant and reinstates sig bond. State has provided offer to defendant/counsel. Would like adjourned to July 8th to consider offer. This is the first time that defendant has seen the offer and it was mixed in with the discovery and Rielly indicates that he didn't get the offer with the discovery. Court sets JT for August 13 & 14 @ 8:30 am. Rielly asks for more time. Court now sets JT for 8/27 & 28th. State does not object however Jodi Bendar will be here that day. Court schedules JT back to the August 13 &14th dates.

Defendant Noel Almagro Vandiver in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:45 AM. Court - here on State's motion in regards to bond. State makes argument on bond - asks for cash bond for stated reasons. Rielly makes argument for signature bond. Court continues bond at this point.

Defendant Noel Almagro Vandiver in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:31 pm. Court has waiver. Court goes thru waiver and finds that defendant is waiving preliminary hearing freely, voluntarily and intelligently, finds probable cause, binds over. INFO filed (mirrors) waive reading and proceed to ARGN, pleads NG to all 13 counts in information. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with Robert McGeshick Jr., Shayna McGeshick or Laurie Olds and no consumption of alcohol. The defendant appears for any preliminary hearings in Forest County Case #15CF21 (State vs Laurie Olds).

Defendant Noel Almagro Vandiver appears via video from FOSO. Attorney Rielly appears in person. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:20 AM. Also called 15CF21 (State vs Laurie Olds) Rielly has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH and wants to be heard on bond. Court prefers to read the complaint to the defendant and does so. Vandiver understands charges and penalties. Rielly wants to be heard on bond prior to setting the matter for PH - argues bond - requests high signature bond. State - bond - no objections to signature bond but would like conditions of: no contact with Robert McGeshick, Shayna McGeshick or Laurie Olds. Court - bond - $3000.00 signature bond with no contact with Robert McGeshick Jr., Shayna McGeshick or Laurie Olds and no consumption of alcohol . Rielly waives time limits for PH. Court sets for PH. State - still being held on the material witness warrant for Laurie Olds. Court will have JA set 15CF21 for PH as it has to be coordinated with her attorney. Vandiver makes statement in regards to why he was not here at PH. State has no objections to the defendant being released from the warrant on 15CF21 and put bond conditions in regards to that. Court modifies the bond in 15CF23 that the defendant appears for any preliminary hearings in Forest County Case #15CF21 (State vs Laurie Olds). Court quashes the material witness warrant in 15CF21  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
